member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartTextAppearance.Row
member.summary: Identifies a Row from the Chart's data.

remarks.p: Each (row, column) tuple in the chart's data corresponds to a graphical chart element. Developers can specify the graphical chart element on which this ChartText appears by assigning a value to this property and .

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartTextAppearance.Column
member.summary: Identifies a Column from the Chart's data.

remarks.p: Each (row, column) tuple in the chart's data corresponds to a graphical chart element. Developers can specify the graphical chart element on which this ChartText appears by assigning a value to and this property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartTextAppearance.Visible
member.summary: Indicates whether the chart text label is displayed.

remarks.p: Ensure this property has been set to True or this chart text label will not be displayed. Other reasons why chart text labels may not appear on a chart include:

ll.ul: This object may not have been added to the property (named ChartText) of the correct chart control.
The values assigned to and do not identify a graphical chart element, or these identify a graphical chart element outside the current viewport (due to scaling and/or scrolling.)

Setting (often on bar charts) or (often on column charts) to an inappropriate alignment. When the underlying bar or column comes into contact with a near or far axis, rendering the label could cause it to appear outside the grid (region between axes). In these cases the label will be clipped, and the appropriate alignment property should be adjusted to make the chart text label visible.

When the format string set in is unrecognized or does not apply to the current chart type, a partial or empty label may render. For instance, applying the <DATA_VALUE_Z> keyword that is applicable in a bubble chart context to chart text appearing on a two-dimensional line chart (having only X and Y data values) will cause an empty string to be rendered.
A chart text label may be temporarily concealed by highlighting if the label appears inside a graphical element and the highlight is opaque.
The is the same, or close to, the background color of the chart.

remarks.p: Multiple ChartTextAppearance objects can apply to the same graphical chart element (identified by the same ( row, column)) and be alternated by toggling their Visible properties such that only one piece of chart text is displayed at once.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartTextAppearance.ChartTextFont
member.summary: Identifies the Font object that specifies which font is used for this Chart Text label.

remarks.p: The property specifies the color of the font used for Chart Text label text.
By default, a 10pt Arial font is used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartTextAppearance.FontColor
member.summary: Determines the Color used when rendering this Chart Text label.

remarks.p: The property specifies the font used for label text.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartTextAppearance.ItemFormatString
member.summary: Specifies what chart text will be rendered.

remarks.p: The property specifies the text of the label that is rendered inside of the chart. It can support any custom keywords (for example, <DATA_VALUE:#0.00>), or it may be a literal text string ("Hello").
Please consult the documentation topics on Labeling Concepts and String Formats for more information on applicable keywords.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartTextAppearance.HorizontalAlign
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the horizontal alignment of chart text.

remarks.p: The HorizontalAlign property specifies specifies horizontal alignment of label text. See also the property for specifying chart text vertical alignment. Together these properties simulate the capability of while supporting right-to-left writing systems.

Two or more objects may apply to the same graphical chart element (identified by the same ( row, column) tuple) and be simultaneously displayed without overlapping if their font's size and alignment styles permit.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartTextAppearance.VerticalAlign
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the vertical alignment of chart text.

remarks.p: The VerticalAlign property specifies vertical alignment of label text. See also the property. Together these properties emulate the alignment choices of while supporting right-to-left writing systems.

Two objects can apply to the same graphical chart element (identified by the same ( row, column) tuple) and be simultaneously displayed without overlapping if their font's size permits and their alignments are near and far.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartTextAppearance.PositionFromRadius
member.summary: Specifies the Position from the Radius of the Chart Text label.

remarks.p: This property retrieves the position from the radius of a chart text label. It can have a value of between 0 to 100, inclusive, and is initialized to 50 by default. This property only applies to chart text on pie-style chart types.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartTextAppearanceConverter
member.summary: Auxillary class that helps with ChartTextAppearance object conversions.

remarks.p: This class exposes methods that identify whether it is capable of helping to convert a object into another type of object, and then performing those conversions. This functionality is predominantly required for serialization and design-time support.
Please consult the documentation for the ExpandableObjectConverter class for more details on the usage of this helper class.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartTextAppearanceConverter.CanConvertTo(System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext,System.Type)
member.summary: Indicates whether conversion to an arbitrary type is possible.
member.param: A context applicable when called from the environs of a TypeConverter.
A Type that is the target of a conversion.
member.returns: True if conversion is supported, or false if not.

remarks.p: Developers should call this method prior to calling , to determine whether a type conversion into an InstanceDescriptor is supported by this class.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartTextAppearanceConverter.ConvertTo(System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext,System.Globalization.CultureInfo,System.Object,System.Type)
member.summary: Converts ChartTextAppearance instances into InstanceDescriptor objects.
member.param: An ITypeDescriptor that provides context when this method is called within the context of a TypeConverter.
Identifies the Culture for the type to convert to.
An instance object to convert.
The type to convert an object into.
member.returns: An object of the destinationType, or null if that conversion wasn't possible.

remarks.p: This method converts objects of into InstanceDescriptor objects that are used during serialization and for the design-time environment. Call the method to ascertain whether conversion between two Types is supported.

Since types in .NET vary on culture, two types having the same name with different cultures are distinct types. Make sure that when converting types the culture argument to this method matches the culture of the Infragistics assemblies installed on the machine.

Additionally, the method requires that the chartText parameter be of type ChartTextAppearance. The destinationType must be of type InstanceDescriptor. If either of these criteria are not met, then this method falls back on the base class implementation, if any.
Please consult the documentation for the InstanceDescriptor for more details on the usage of this helper class.

remarks.p: This class is exposed as the ChartText property on the UltraChart control. It contains the objects. Each ChartTextAppearance object contained in this collection represents an individual label that may be displayed someplace on the chart grid.

member.summary: Provides the index of a given ChartTextAppearance, if ChartTextCollection contains it.
member.param: A ChartTextAppearance object to search the collection for.
member.returns: The index at which the given ChartTextAppearance was found, or -1 if it was not found.

remarks.p: This method returns the index of a matching object reference within the collection. It does not perform a property-by-property comparison, so equivalent ChartTextAppearance objects may not be found.
IndexOf always returns -1 when returns False, however when a valid index is returned it can be used to retrieve the ChartTextAppearance object using the index property of ChartTextCollection.

remarks.p: This property specifies whether null data encountered in the bound data source should be treated as having a zero value, or an average value of the adjacent data points.
See the enumeration for the values that indicate how nulls are handled.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ColumnChartAppearance.SeriesSpacing
member.summary: The spacing between series, in column width increments.

remarks.p: This property determines how much space is placed between series. The value is specified in Column Width increments, so the space will always by a multiple of the width of a column of data.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ColumnChartAppearance.ChartText
member.summary: Collection of Chart Text labels that can be rendered over the columns of this Column Chart.

remarks.p: The ChartText collection exposed by this property accepts objects that each represent the style and content of an individual label appearing on one of the chart columns plotted.

Column Charts normally render one row of data as a series, and each column of data as a column within the series. As an example, the Row of chart text appearing on a column in the second series would be 1. If the chart text appeared on the fourth column of that second series, its Column would be 3. Alignment of chart text is centered by default, developers may wish to set the VerticalAlign to Near or Far to place it above or below the column's outline. Developers must also set the Visible property to True to make chart text labels display.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ColumnLineChartAppearance
member.summary: An Appearance object governing the presentation qualities for the hybrid Column-Line Chart.

remarks.p: As with any hybrid chart appearance, instances of the ColumnLineAppearance class are dual-binding. This class exposes an Appearance and DataAppearance property of both the Column Chart (tied to the X- and Y- axes) and the Line Chart (tied to the secondary X2- and Y2- axes).

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.DataAppearance
member.summary: An Appearance object that encapsulates those properties related to the data for a chart, and how that data should be filtered.

remarks.p: The DataAppearance class manages the appearance of the data in the chart, including it's filtering (even if the application doesn't already take advantage of the filtering capabilities of the DataView class).

The primary purpose of this Appearance object that all developers need to be comfortable with is using the property and method to set the data source and initiate binding to that data source. Data sources that support the Framework's IBindingList interface (this includes data tables) support live updates to the chart reflecting changes within the data.

Additional filter support in DataAppearance includes whether the chart should be Zero-aligned to a linear, numeric axis (see the property), exclusive limits that establish a band of data that should be presented (see the , and properties), and whether the rows and columns in the data source should be transposed prior to charting (see the property).

member.summary: Forces the chart data to be refreshed.

remarks.p: When first binding the chart control to a data source, it is necessary to assign a data source to the property and call the DataBind() method.

Normally, the chart will automatically update it's display when it recieves a notification from the that something has changed. However, if the DataSource does not provide this notification, this method can be called to refresh the chart.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.DataAppearance.DataSource
member.summary: Gets/sets the object which the Chart uses for data.
member.returns: A variety of object types may be specified as the DataSource, see below for details.

remarks.p: The control supports a variety of data source types.

The most robust and extensible data source is the DataTable, which provides update notifications via the IBindingList interface. Use of these built-in ADO.NET data management types offers the greatest flexibility.

Many charts also support data-binding to ICollections (including simple arrays) provided the a single-typed, one-dimensional array can meet the chart type's Data Requirements. Chartable data sources include custom ICollections, and custom data objects that additionally support IBindingList may take advantage of live data-binding to the chart component.
Another data source that may be provided is the local filename of an XML or comma-delimited text file.

XML documents require an internal XML Schema document, and must be readily mappable to the Framework's DataSet (their msdata:IsDataSet attribute is set to true). The schema is also necessary since each XML element must be strongly-typed (otherwise their data type will be inferred as xsd:string and this will not translate readily into a DataSet, even though the data content of the element may be numeric.) Please see Generating DataSet Relational Structure from XML Schema in the .NET Framework documentation for more on the issues involved, and consult the samples included with this product for working schema.
Data may be unbound from a chart by calling the method.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.DataAppearance.UseRowLabelsColumn
member.summary: Enables/disables the use of row labels when plotting the chart.

remarks.p: Developers must set this property to true, and provide the zero-based index of the column containing series or row labels to the property for custom row labeling to work.
Charts may extract the first string column present in a data set for use as row labels, if none are explicitly provided.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.DataAppearance.RowLabelsColumn
member.summary: Gets/Sets the index of the column in the DataSource that the chart will use as the text label for each row.

remarks.p: The column index specified by this property must be zero-based (ie, a column index of 2 corresponds to the third column in the data). The column's data type must be string, or it must be readily convertible to string. Values outside of the range of columns (below 0 or greater than the number of columns) will be ignored.
This mechanism for custom-supplying series or row labels from the data can be toggled on or off, see the property for details.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.DataAppearance.MaxValue
member.summary: Gets/Sets the the maximum data value (inclusive) for chart elements shown.
member.returns: The maximum data value (upper bound, inclusive) on the range of chart elements shown.

remarks.p: This property supports turning off the display of chart elements whose values exceed the specified Maximum data value. Chart elements falling within the range defined by this property, in concert with , are shown in-place (the chart does not collapse to show only those filtered elements). This filtering can be turned off by setting the property to False.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.DataAppearance.MinValue
member.summary: Gets/Sets the the minimum data value (inclusive) for chart elements shown.
member.returns: The minimum data value (lower bound, inclusive) on the range of chart elements shown.

remarks.p: This property supports turning off the display of chart elements whose values are below the specified Minimum data value. Chart elements falling within the range defined by this property, in concert with , are shown in-place (the chart does not collapse to show only those filtered elements). This filtering can be turned off by setting the property to False.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.DataAppearance.UseMinMax
member.summary: Enables/disables the use of Max- and MinValue to filter which chart elements appear.
member.returns: A Boolean flag indicating whether Max- and MinValue in-place filtering is enabled.

remarks.p: This property is a flag that enabled the in-place filtering of chart elements shown. Please see the documentation for the and properties for more information on utilizing this feature.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.DataAppearance.SwapRowsAndColumns
member.summary: Gets/sets whether rows and columns are swapped.

remarks.p: When this property is set (it is not set by default), the rows and columns in the DataSource will be transposed to render in the opposite way from which they are typically shown. Rows (series) become columns (items) and columns (items) will become rows (series).

This method can be used to alter a data source that doesn't initially conform to a chart's Data Requirements to become chartable. It can also invalidate a data source that previously met the requirements for a chart type, because the data will no longer do so (in its transposed state).

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.DataAppearance.ZeroAligned
member.summary: Gets/sets whether the primary numeric axis should align itself with the origin at zero.
member.returns: True when the primary axis is zero-aligned, False otherwise.

remarks.p: When zero alignment is in effect, the chart will be rendered with its primary, linear, numeric axis range starting at zero, as opposed to the minimum data value present in the DataSource.

This property does not apply to non-numeric (for instance, axes based on dates or discrete item labels) or non-continuous axes (for instance, logarithmic axes for which log 0 is mathematically undefined).

Developers can use this feature when they want their minimum data values to display and showing the axis at the origin is relevant. When there is little variation between data values (i.e., the difference between the maximum and minimum values being charted is small compared to the minimum value's difference from the zero-axis), it is a better choice to adjust the RangeAxisType to Custom on the and set the RangeMin and RangeMax properties instead of using zero-alignment.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.DataAppearance.DataMember
member.summary: Gets/sets a specific list in DataMember for which the control displays the data.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.DoughnutChartAppearance
member.summary: An Appearance object providing presentation qualities for how Doughnut Charts are distinctly displayed.

remarks.p: This Appearance extends upon the properties in , many of which are equally applicable to Doughnut Charts. A Doughnut Chart is just a Pie Chart with a hole in the middle.
The hole in the middle of the Doughnut Chart is specified by the property, and this must be smaller than the radius of the outer edge of the Doughnut Chart's sectors.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PieChartAppearance.BreakSlice(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Breaks or unbreaks an individual slice off from the center of the pie.
member.param: The slice number from 0 to number of slices - 1.
Whether or not to break the slice.

remarks.p: Developers should use either this method, or one of the breaking flags (see , or ) to break slices from the Pie Chart. The effect of using multiple breakage methods is undefined.

The slice number can be thought of in correspondence to a data column representing the slice. Whereas additional data columns may appear before the column represented by the first slice, a slice number will always be zero-aligned. For example, if column indices 3, 4 and 5 are rendered in the pie chart, these columns correspond to slice numbers 0, 1, and 2, respectively.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PieChartAppearance.GetOnlyExplicitlyBrokenSlices
member.summary: Returns a list that allows you to enumerate the index numbers of the pie slices which are 'broken' explicitly by the numbers.
member.returns: An IList of explicitly broken slices.

remarks.p: This property returns an IList of only those slices which were explicitly broken individually using the method.
It does not include slices that were broken as a result of another property such as , , or .

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PieChartAppearance.BreakSliceReset
member.summary: Reset all slices which were broken by the BreakSlice method back to their original state.

remarks.p: This method affects only slices which were explicitly broken individually using the method.
It does not affect slices that were broken as a result of another property such as , , or .

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PieChartAppearance.ShouldSerialize
member.summary: Check if any property has a non-default value.
member.returns: Returns True if there exists a property of this Appearance with a modified value, otherwise False is returned.

remarks.p: If any property of this Appearance object has a non-default value, then this Appearance object must be serialized in order to reconstitute itself at a future time.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PieChartAppearance.Labels
member.summary: A PieLabelAppearance object which determines how the labels on a Pie Chart will be displayed.

remarks.p: This child appearance manages various aspects of the text labels appearing alongside the Pie Chart, such as their style, formatting, leader lines appearance, et al.
To add text within the slices of a Pie Chart, developers can add objects to the collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PieChartAppearance.ColumnIndex
member.summary: Gets/sets the column number whose data will be used in the Pie Chart.

remarks.p: This property determines which column in the Data Source is displayed in the Pie Chart as data. Column indices are zero-based.
If the specified column is non-numeric, the Chart will check each column after it, in order, until it finds a numeric column.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PieChartAppearance.RadiusFactor
member.summary: Radius of the Pie Chart is scaled with this property.

remarks.p: If the Pie Chart is scaled too large, leader lines and labels may be clipped at the edges of the control. Developers can avoid this by reducing the RadiusFactor, or through setting LeaderLinesVisible to False and FormatString to String.Empty.
The default value for RadiusFactor is 90. Values smaller than 90 reduce the amount of the chart area the Pie Chart consumes, values greater than 90 increase the area consumed by the Pie Chart.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PieChartAppearance.StartAngle
member.summary: Gets/sets the angle in degrees (0-360) to begin rendering the pie slices.

remarks.p: The first pie slice (based on the first row of data) will be rendered at the given angle. Successive slices are then rendered clockwise from the first slice starting at the 3 o' clock orientation.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PieChartAppearance.BreakDistancePercentage
member.summary: Gets/sets the space between the pie slices.

remarks.p: This value is specified as a percentage of the Pie Radius, so it ranges from 0 to 100.
This property will have no effect unless another breaking property such as , , or is set to True.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PieChartAppearance.BreakAllSlices
member.summary: Gets/Sets whether the PieChart renders a break in between every slice.

remarks.p: The size of the break is specified by the property.
The effect of setting this property and any of the other breaking flags ( or ) is undefined.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PieChartAppearance.BreakAlternatingSlices
member.summary: Gets/sets whether every alternate slice in the pie is seperated by a break.

remarks.p: The size of the break is specified by the property.
The effect of setting this property and any of the other breaking flags ( or ) is undefined.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PieChartAppearance.BreakOthersSlice
member.summary: Gets/sets whether the 'Other' slice is rendered broken away from the pie.

remarks.p: The size of the break is specified by the property.
The effect of setting this property and any of the other breaking flags ( or ) is undefined.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PieChartAppearance.OthersCategoryPercent
member.summary: Gets/sets the minimum value, expressed as a decimal percentage, to render as a full slice independently.

remarks.p: Any slice whose percentage exceeds this value will be rendered as a full independent slice. All slices whose percetage is less than this value will be combined and displayed as one 'Other' slice.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PieChartAppearance.OthersCategoryText
member.summary: Gets/sets the text label that is used for the Others Category.

remarks.p: All items fitting into the Others Category will be associated with the label generated by this property setting.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PieChartAppearance.PieThickness
member.summary: Gets/sets the thickness of each pie slice in a 3-D Pie Chart.

remarks.p: Thickness is only supported for 3-D Pie Chart. It does not apply to 2-D Charts because flat pies have no thickness.
The valid range of values for the thickness of the pie are from 0 to 40.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PieChartAppearance.ChartText
member.summary: Collection of Chart Text labels rendered within the slices of the Pie Chart.

remarks.p: Chart Text and Pie Labels each have their own uses, and differ in two key respects. Whereas the class governs text labels appearing on the outside of the pie slices of a Pie Chart (optionally connected to slices by "leader lines"), the ChartText collection accepts objects that each represent the style and content of an individual label appearing on one of the pie slices. Another difference is that Chart Text applies to most 2-D chart types, where as PieLabelAppearance only applies to Pie Charts.

Pie Charts normally render one row of data, so the Row of the chart text will typically be initialized to 0. The Column should be set to the column index of the pie slice (not necessarily the same as the slice number of the pie wedge). Developers must also set the Visible property to True for any chart text labels displayed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.DoughnutChartAppearance.InnerRadius
member.summary: Gets/sets the radius of the inner hole, as a percentage of the outer hole, in the Doughnut Chart.

remarks.p: Percentage of the inner hole of the doughnut to it's outer radius. Valid values range from 25% to 75% of the doughnut's radius.
Developers can vary this percentage to achieve visual results that range from a ring chart to a tire chart.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.DrillDownAppearance
member.summary: DrillDownAppearance provides properties used in the preparation and processing of drill down charts.

remarks.p: DrillDownAppearance is an extension of ChartAppearance, and provides the properties necessary for developers to define a drill down hierarchy and manage the user's navigation of drillable charts at run-time.

Drill-enabling your chart is as easy as setting the DrillElement property to an array of one or more initialized DrillElement objects, and turning on the Enabled property. See the DrillElement class for more information on how to initialize a DrillElement object to represent a node in the drill down hierarchy.
Additional features exposed by DrillDownAppearance include the ability to show a drill back button on the chart grid, activated by the ShowButtons property.

The DrillDownAppearance property only supports UltraWinChart applications and not UltraWebChart. Due to the disconnected nature of the Web, persisting information on the entire drill down hierarchy at once is not supported. UltraWebChart developers should follow the approach of subscribing ChartDataClickEventHandlers to listen for the ChartDataClick event, and persisting only the drill down information necessary in Session State. In UltraWebChart, the DataSource must be bound on each postback.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.DrillDownAppearance.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new DrillDownAppearance object.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.DrillDownAppearance.#ctor(Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.IChartComponent)
member.summary: Constructs a new DrillDownAppearance object belonging to a given IChartComponent.
member.param: Chart component that this DrillDownAppearance belongs to, registered through ChartAppearance.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.DrillDownAppearance.ToString
member.summary: Overridden to return information about available DrillElements.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.DrillDownAppearance.DrillBack
member.summary: Drills back up one level in the drill down hierarchy to the parent chart of the currently displayed chart.

remarks.p: This method allows application logic to drill back up the chart, refreshing the chart with the information and presentation of the parent chart. The effects of calling DrillBack() or using the property is identical.

Developers may call DrillBack() repeatedly in a loop, until the method returns false, to quickly ascend to the topmost chart in the drill down hierarchy from any child chart. When doing so, it is advisable to first set UltraChart's Visible property to false to prevent screen flicker as chart type may change in the process of drilling back to the topmost chart from great depth.

member.returns: True if the user drilled back up one level, false otherwise (the user must already be at the topmost chart in the drill down hierarchy).

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.DrillDownAppearance.DrillElements
member.summary: Holds a collection of DrillElements objects, each describing a chart node in the drill down hierarchy.

remarks.p: Set the DrillElements property to a non-null, non-empty array to define the drill down hierarchy (the tree-like structure of parent and child charts descendant from one top-level chart). Each DrillElement object in this array should be initialized prior to the user interacting with the Chart, so it's advisable that this property be initialized in Form or Page load events.

The drill down hierarchy contains nodes describing the necessary properties of child charts descendent from one topmost chart (the chart appearing when UltraChart is first databound and displayed before any drill down has occured).

The consequences of changing DrillElement objects in this collection once the user has interacted with the drill down hierarchy are undefined. If you must make changes to the structure of the drill down hierarchy, return the user to the topmost chart.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.DrillDownAppearance.Enabled
member.summary: Enables/disables Drill Down for the Chart.

remarks.p: Enables drill down functionality in UltraChart. Before drill down can be fully realized, the DrillElement property must be initialized with an array of DrillElements that describe the drill down hierarchy.

For all WebCharts and WinCharts with custom Drill Down (IDrillDown) implemented, this property will have no effect. To disable Drill Down in a custom IDrillDown implementation, avoid calling your custom Drill method in the ChartDataClicked event handler.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.DrillDownAppearance.DrillDownHandler
member.summary: This member supports the charting internal infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.DrillDownAppearance.ShowButton
member.summary: Activates a small button in the upper-left corner of a Chart's area that automatically drills back.

remarks.p: When active, a drill back button is automatically displayed at the top-left corner of the chart grid (it may appear outside of Pie and Doughnut charts since they have no upper-right corner). It appears behind graphed objects when those objects are highlighted. It isn't possible to relocate this button, and it is not shown by default.

As an alternative to using ShowButton, developers can provide their own Button or user interface experience to control drill back. The UltraChart class exposes a DrillBack() method that can be called by application logic (such as in an ClickEvent handler).

Whether the user navigates up the drill down hierarchy using the provided button or an application generated DrillBack() call, the effect of returning to the parent chart is the same. Since this button does not appear, it is incumbent upon developers to either turn on ShowButton or provide their own DrillBack() call to enable users to revisit parent charts.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.DrillDownAppearance.Depth
member.summary: Depth in the drill down hierarchy, measured from the topmost chart.

remarks.p: This property returns the depth (or "drilled level") in the drill down hierarchy of the currently displayed child chart. Each time a user drills down, depth (their distance from the topmost chart) increases by one level. Calling the () method or using the drill back button (see the property), both reduce the depth by one level.

Depth is read-only. It cannot be directly modified to skip several levels in the drill down hierarchy. It is possible to have multiple objects refer to equivalent child charts (identical s and DataSources), even at different depths in the drill down hierarchy, thereby simulating the appearance of diving several levels at once.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.GridlinesAppearance
member.summary: An Appearance object describing the style for Axis Gridlines (major and minor).

remarks.p: Gridlines come in two types: major and minor. They appear alternating in two-dimensional chart grids by default, based on the major and minor tickmark intervals. Developers should design the style of minor gridlines to be more subtle than that applied to major gridlines, if minor gridlines are used at all. Each is associated with a pair of GridlinesAppearance objects.

Gridlines automatically scroll and scale in conjunction with the current scrollbar position, and usually have a fixed correspondence to axis labels, if labels appear. Labels may not always correspond to gridlines if custom keywords are used and some tickmarks are therefore not labeled by a charting application's design.
Gridlines are always rendered perpendicular to their parent axis.
This appearance object only supports the customizability of 2-D Charts' gridlines.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.GridlinesAppearance.Visible
member.summary: Gets/sets whether the GridLines are visible.
member.remarks:
When true, the chart will display grid lines. ///
Minor Gridlines apply only to 2D Charts. 3D Charts will show Major GridLines, but not Minor GridLines.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.GridlinesAppearance.DrawStyle
member.summary: Gets/sets the style in which the gridlines are to be rendered.

remarks.p: Determines how the gridlines will be rendered (e.g. Solid, Dash, Dotted, etc.). If Visible is False, this property is ignored and no Gridlines are dislayed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.GridlinesAppearance.Color
member.summary: Gets/sets the color of the gridlines on the parent axis.

remarks.p: Determines the line color of the gridlines. If Visible is set to False, this property is ignored and no GridLines are displayed.
The actual color rendered may change based on the AlphaLevel.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.GridlinesAppearance.Thickness
member.summary: Gets/sets the thickness of the gridlines in pixels.

remarks.p: Determines the thickness of the GridLines. If Visible is False, this property is ignored and no Gridlines are dislayed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.GridlinesAppearance.AlphaLevel
member.summary: Gets/sets the level of Alphablending to use when rendering the grid lines.

remarks.p: AlphaLevel ranges from 0 (transparent) to 255 (opaque).

member.summary: Specifies whether Nulls in the data are treated as zero or as the average of adjacent data values.

member.summary: Gets/sets the level of quality used when rendering the data points of a HeatMap chart.

remarks.p: Higher settings will result in better looking charts but will draw more slowly.
For HeatMap 3D charts, only Medium and Low settings are supported.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.HeatMapChartAppearance.ChartText
member.summary: Collection of Chart Text labels that can be rendered over the surface of 2-D Heat Map Charts.

remarks.p: The ChartText collection exposed by this property accepts objects that each represent the style and content of an individual label appearing onto one of the tiles of the heat map surface area.
Chart text applies to 2-D heat maps only.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.LegendAppearance
member.summary: An Appearance object containing all the style properties for Chart legend boxes.

remarks.p: The chart legend box appears alongside the chart grid and one of the borders (top, left, bottom or right positioning only). Inside the chart legend there can appear a key that can aide end users in understanding some chart types. Many qualities of the legend are dependent upon ChartType.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.LegendAppearance.Visible
member.summary: Gets/sets a Boolean which determins whether the Legend is displayed.

remarks.p: Setting the Visible flag to True causes the Legend box to be displayed at the side of the chart control area.

Changing this value at run-time can cause the Chart grid to expand to take up the portion of space within the control that was previous reserved by for the Legend box. To overcome this side effect of hiding a Legend Box, developers may wish to use the Extent property of an adjacent Axis to reserve an amount of space equivalent to that reserved for the Legend were it visible. This is usually only possible if the Axis is not otherwise being used by the chart.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.LegendAppearance.Location
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the Legend in the chart.

remarks.p: The legend may only be located along one of the borders of the chart, see the LegendLocation enumeration for possible settings.
Developers can cause a legend to appear in one of the corners of the chart (rather than take up the width or height of the chart control) by selectively adjusting the property values.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.LegendAppearance.SpanPercentage
member.summary: Gets/sets the percentage of the relevant chart's dimension that the Legend box consumes.

remarks.p: This is a percentage value that must be between 0 and 100. The developer is responsible for setting a value appropriate to display a presentable chart. Large values for SpanPercentage tend to make the Legend box appear larger than the chart, and can make the chart unreadable. Very small values for SpanPercentage may make the Legend box unreadable.

The dimension spanned by the Legend box is the width of the chart control area (when is set to Left or Right) or its height (when Location is set to either Top or Bottom). This area can be shortened by setting the property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.LegendAppearance.Font
member.summary: Gets/sets the Font to use for drawing the text labels within the Legend box.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.LegendAppearance.FontColor
member.summary: Gets/sets the Font color to use for drawing text labels within the Legend box.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.LegendAppearance.BackgroundColor
member.summary: Gets/sets the background fill color for the Legend box.

remarks.p: The effect of setting an alpha-component on the BackgroundColor while specifying a separate for the Legend box background fill is undefined. It is recommended that the fill color assigned to Background color always be fully opaque (with an Alpha value of 255) and that any transparency should be added through the AlphaLevel property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.LegendAppearance.BorderThickness
member.summary: Gets/sets the thickness of the Legend box border in pixels.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.LegendAppearance.BorderColor
member.summary: Gets/sets the color of the Legend box border.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.LegendAppearance.Margins
member.summary: Gets the MarginsAppearance object, which determines the extent of margin surrounding the Legend box.

remarks.p: The Margins can be specified on each of the four sides of the Legend box. Developers can employ the Margins property in concert with the and properties to locate a Legend box closer to the corners of the chart.
If values are given for the Margins that exceed the Extent region of the adjacent axis, then the Legend box may not have enough space to render itself and the effects are undefined.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.LegendAppearance.BorderStyle
member.summary: Gets/sets the the LineDrawStyle of the Legend box border.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.LegendAppearance.AlphaLevel
member.summary: Gets/sets the level of Alphablending to use when rendering the Legend box.

remarks.p: AlphaLevel ranges from 0 (completely transparent) to 255 (opaque).

When the AlphaLevel has been set to completely transparent, the Legend box will not be filled unless it is a scale (which renders in the spectral scales own colors), however any icons and text are rendered as if appearing in mid-air.
The effect of specifying an AlphaLevel with this property, and a separate alpha-component on , is undefined.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.LegendAppearance.FormatString
member.summary: Gets/sets the legend format string to use when generating the labels for the Legend.

remarks.p: Please see Labelling and Label Formats under the Key Features Overview for detailed information about Label formats.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.LegendAppearance.DataAssociation
member.summary: Gets/sets the chart sub-type whose data is to be associated with this Legend.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.LineChartAppearance.StartStyle
member.summary: Gets/sets the LineCapStyle for drawing the beginning of each plotted line.

remarks.p: This property determines what (if anything) is drawn at the beginning of a plotted line. The starting point of a line segment is the Point at which drawing starts (this is commonly from left-to-right, but lines can be drawn from any other direction).

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.LineChartAppearance.EndStyle
member.summary: Gets/sets the LineCapStyle for drawing the termination of each plotted line.

remarks.p: This property determines what (if anything) is drawn at the end point of each plotted line.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.LineChartAppearance.DrawStyle
member.summary: Gets/sets the LineDrawStyle for drawing each plotted line of a Line chart.

remarks.p: Determines how the lines will be rendered (e.g. Solid, Dash, Dotted, etc.)

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.LineChartAppearance.MidPointAnchors
member.summary: Gets/sets a flag which determines whether data points between each segment of each plotted line in a Line chart are shown.

remarks.p: This flag determines whether midpoint anchors are displayed between each plotted line in the chart. Midpoint anchors may appear as rounded points, small squares, or other visual cues that a data point exists at that point on the line. If the data points form a nearly linear line, end users may have difficulty recognizing data points along the line unless they have been emphasized with a midpoint anchor.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.LineChartAppearance.HighLightLines
member.summary: Gets/sets a Boolean which determines whether an entire line is to be highlighted when one of the points on the line is highlighted.

remarks.p: Determines whether or not lines are entirely to be highlighted when any point is highlighted along that line (series) in the chart.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.LineChartAppearance.NullHandling
member.summary: Returns or sets an enumerated flag that indicates whether or not the Null data points are to be handled as zero or the average-value of successive data points.

remarks.p: This property specifies whether null data has to be handled as if it were a zero data point, or whether it should be treated as if it had the average value of the two most adjacent, non-null data points.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.LineChartAppearance.ChartText
member.summary: Collection of Chart Text labels that can be rendered over the data points of this Line Chart.

remarks.p: The ChartText collection exposed by this property accepts objects that each represent the style and content of an individual label appearing at one of the data points plotted along a line.

Line Charts normally render one row of data to a line, so the Row of all chart text appearing on the same line is typically initialized to the same value. The Column should be set to the column index corresponding to the data point along the line at which the chart text label is to be rendered. Alignment of chart text relative to a data point is not supported, the chart text will be rendered on top of the point (as if it were horizontally and vertically center-aligned). Developers must also set the Visible property to True to make chart text labels display.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.MarginsAppearance
member.summary: This child Appearance class defines the margins surrounding (usually) text regions on the chart.

remarks.p: The Margins are a child Appearance that exists on other Appearance objects, and that exposes properties permitting developers to specify the amount of space on each side (top, bottom, left and right) of text areas. The Margin is most often used on objects.

It is the responsibility of developers to ensure that property values set on the MarginsAppearance object are presentable, as there are is no layout management afforded by MarginsAppearance to prevent poor choices in property values.
The base class takes care of notifications of the parent Appearance object whenever the properties of MarginsAppearance change.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.MarginsAppearance.#ctor
member.summary: This default constructor allows developers to create a new MarginsAppearance for passing into another Appearance object.

remarks.p: The MarginsAppearance is initially created with all margins set to 0 pixels.
Enabling parent Appearance notification requires developers to also call the SetParentAppearance and SetParentProperty methods of the base class.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PaintElement
member.summary: The characteristics applied when filling and outlining Primitives and Appearance properties.

remarks.p: Primitves and certain ChartAppearance subclasses that expose properties with sophisticated filling features use PaintElement objects to describe the characteristics of how they are filled and outlined. This type encapsulates those methods and properties developers may already expect from Brush (fill) and Pen (stroke) objects in other GUI environments.
PaintElement objects are only applicable to objects that support all of the following sophisticated filling techniques:
Appearance objects that don't require PaintElement's broad support will only expose a fill or background color property (and possibly border color and thickness properties) for solid fills only.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PaintElement.GetPen(Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PaintElement)
member.summary: Gets a pen to outline shapes.
member.returns: A pen used to outline shapes.

remarks.p: The characteristics of the GDI+ Pen returned (it's color, opacity, thickness) are based on the provided instance.
The pen returned will produce a solid line.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PaintElement.GetBrush(Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PaintElement,System.Drawing.Drawing2D.GraphicsPath)
member.summary: Gets a brush to fill non-rectangular areas.
member.param: A paint element describing what sort of brush to return.
A path object describing a non-rectangular Primitive.
member.returns: A brush initialized by the PaintElement for the given path Primitive object.

remarks.p: This method is called to supply an appropriate GDI+ Brush object corresponding to the properties of a instance.

When the shape of the area that requires filling is rectangular (or can be closely approximated by a rectangle without loss in a fill's fidelity), use the rect version of this method for better performance.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PaintElement.GetBrush(Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PaintElement,System.Drawing.Rectangle)
member.summary: Gets a brush to fill rectangular areas.
member.param: A paint element describing what sort of brush to return.
A rectangle describing the Primitive's bounding box.
member.returns: A brush initialized by the PaintElement for the given rectangular object.

remarks.p: This method is called to supply an appropriate GDI+ Brush object corresponding to the properties of a instance.

When the shape of the area that requires filling is not rectangular, use the path version of this method that for greater reliability in tiling and scaling resulting textures, gradients and/or hatches. On the other hand, this method should be preferred for all solid fills for better performance. In general solid fills do not depend on the shape of the graphics object.

member.summary: Gets a brush to fill shapes with a translucent highlighting effect.
member.param: A paint element.
A GraphicsPath object describing the shape to be highlighted.
The highligted color.
member.returns: A brush to fill in highligted areas.

member.summary: Style of texture application for this PaintElement if its ElementType is set to Texture.

member.summary: Determines which texture to use for this PaintElement if its ElementType is set to Texture.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PaintElement.ImageFitStyle
member.summary: Identifies the Fit style applied to Image.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PaintElement.ElementType
member.summary: Identifies the type of painting applied.

remarks.p: A object may actively only be one of the types in the enumeration. Setting a property (, or ) will automatically update the property with the most current value.

It is sometimes convenient for developers to pre-initialize several sets of paint properties (a texture, a gradient and a hatch for instance) and then switch between them by adjusting the 's type with one assignment during the application's processing.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PaintElement.ImageWrapMode
member.summary: Defines how textures should be tiled and/or wrapped.

remarks.p: This property only applies to texture fills specified with the property. Please see the documentation for WrapMode for further information on tiling of textures.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PaintElement.Hatch
member.summary: Hatchwork fill pattern applied to the graphical object.

remarks.p: Specifies the for pattern filling of the associated Primitive or Appearance object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PaintElement.Fill
member.summary: Fill color of the associated graphical object.

remarks.p: Fill is used interchangeably as the solid fill color, the starting color for gradient fills (see also the property), depending on whether the has been set, and the foreground color for pattern fills when the property is set.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PaintElement.CustomBrush
member.summary: Custom fill brush.

remarks.p: This property is intended for use by the UltraChart charting infrastructure, and should not be modified by application code.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PaintElement.FillStopColor
member.summary: Secondary fill color for the associated graphical object.

remarks.p: This property value is only used when the or property has been set to one of the supported gradient or hatch patterns. A gradient is a Bell Curve blend from the color to the FillStopColor. In a hatch, this property describes the background color.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PaintElement.FillStopOpacity
member.summary: An opacity for the secondary rendering brush.

remarks.p: A value of 0 represents a transparent brush, whereas a value of 255 represents a completely opaque brush (items behind the filled area are not visible). Values between 0 and 255 represent varying degrees of translucency.
Although it is possible to assign a color with an alpha component to , developers should assign such opacity values to this property instead.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PaintElement.FillOpacity
member.summary: An opacity for the rendering brush.

remarks.p: A value of 0 represents a transparent brush, whereas a value of 255 represents a completely opaque brush (items behind the filled area are not visible). Values between 0 and 255 represent varying degrees of translucency.
Although it is possible to assign a color with an alpha component to , developers should assign such opacity values to this property instead.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PaintElement.FillGradientStyle
member.summary: Determines the gradient fill style applied to the Paint Element's brush.

remarks.p: The gradient fill is a linear interpolation of colors starting from the and running to the , where the change in color is in the direction indicated by the gradient vector.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PaintElement.FillImage
member.summary: Texture to apply to the graphical object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PaintElement.ImagePath
member.summary: Path to FillImage.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PaintElement.Stroke
member.summary: Color of the pen used to outline drawn shapes.

remarks.p: Use this property (and not ) to affect the color of shape outlines).
There are several methods to deactivate the pen used for outlining when this functionality is not desired, including:

li.ul: Set this property to Color.Transparent. This is the preferred means of turning off the use of a pen.
Set the property to 0 (this is technically equivalent to setting this property to Transparent).
Set the property to 0 which renders an outline of zero-thickness (which isn't visible).

remarks.p: While colors with an alpha component may be assigned directly to Stroke, it is highly recommended that developers use the StrokeOpacity property instead.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PaintElement.StrokeOpacity
member.summary: An opacity for the rendering pen.

remarks.p: A value of 0 represents a transparent pen, whereas a value of 255 represents a completely opaque pen. Values between 0 and 255 represent varying degrees of translucency.
This property value overrides any alpha component of the color defined by .

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PaintElement.StrokeWidth
member.summary: Thickness of the pen used to outline graphical objects.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PaintElementConverter
member.summary: Auxillary class that helps with PaintElement object conversions.

remarks.p: This class exposes methods that identify whether it is capable of helping to convert a object into another type of object, and then performing those conversions. This functionality is predominantly required for serialization and design-time support.
Please consult the documentation for the ExpandableObjectConverter class for more details on the usage of this helper class.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PaintElementConverter.CanConvertTo(System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext,System.Type)
member.summary: Indicates whether conversion to an arbitrary type is possible.
member.param: A context applicable when called from the environs of a TypeConverter.
A Type that is the target of a conversion.
member.returns: True if conversion is supported, or false if not.

remarks.p: Developers should call this method prior to calling , to determine whether a type conversion into an InstanceDescriptor is supported by this class.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PaintElementConverter.ConvertTo(System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext,System.Globalization.CultureInfo,System.Object,System.Type)
member.summary: Converts PaintElement instances into InstanceDescriptor objects.
member.param: An ITypeDescriptor that provides context when this method is called within the context of a TypeConverter.
Identifies the Culture for the type to convert to.
An instance object to convert.
The type to convert an object into.
member.returns: An object of the destinationType, or null if that conversion wasn't possible.

remarks.p: This method converts objects of into InstanceDescriptor objects that are used during serialization and for the design-time environment. Call the method to ascertain whether conversion between two Types is supported.

Since types in .NET vary on culture, two types having the same name with different cultures are distinct types. Make sure that when converting types the culture argument to this method matches the culture of the Infragistics assemblies installed on the machine.

Additionally, the method requires that the paintItem parameter be of type PaintElement. The destinationType must be of type InstanceDescriptor. If either of these criteria are not met, then this method falls back on the base class implementation, if any.
Please consult the documentation for the InstanceDescriptor for more details on the usage of this helper class.

member.summary: Returns a string representing the PieLabelAppearance.

remarks.p: The string representation of this Appearance class is displayed in the Property Browser at design-time.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PieLabelAppearance.Format
member.summary: Gets/Sets the Format of the Pie Chart Labels.

remarks.p: The Format can be used to diplay labels in a predefined format (most commonly used for item labeling or data value labeling), or in a custom format (specifying formatting of data values or through custom keywords). When Format is set to Custom, the is used to determine the format in which the labels are displayed. It is important to employ the Custom format even when using standard keywords such as <DATA_VALUE> if a customized format string or 'picture' is used (for instance, <DATA_VALUE:#0.00>).
For detailed information on the possible format strings, please see Labeling and Label Format.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PieLabelAppearance.FormatString
member.summary: Gets/sets the format string for the Pie Chart text labels.

remarks.p: The FormatString is only used when is set to Custom.
For detailed information on the possible format string see Labeling and Label Format.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PieLabelAppearance.LeaderLinesVisible
member.summary: Gets/sets whether the leader lines should be displayed.

remarks.p: Leader lines are lines that connect from the text label of a slice or sector to the slice or sector itself. Using leader lines makes it easier for end users to associate which label belongs with each slice or sector in the chart.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PieLabelAppearance.LeaderLineThickness
member.summary: Gets/sets the thickness of the leader lines in pixels.

remarks.p: This property determines the thickness of the leader lines. If is false, this property is ignored.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PieLabelAppearance.Font
member.summary: Gets/sets the font to use when rendering Pie Chart labels.

remarks.p: All Pie Chart labels outside of the Pie are drawn using the Font specified by this property. Since .NET Framework fonts are read-only objects, changing one or two style characteristics (e.g., boldness) of the Font object requires creating a reference to a new Font object with those style characteristics.
Developers that need to associate supplemental text within the Pie Chart, potentially with a different font selection, may do so through the addition of to slices in the chart.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PieLabelAppearance.FontColor
member.summary: Gets/set the font color to use for the Pie Chart text labels.

remarks.p: All pie labels will be rendered using this font color.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PieLabelAppearance.LeaderEndStyle
member.summary: Gets/set the line drawing style with which leader lines are terminated.

remarks.p: This property determines how the leader lines are terminated (for example, with an arrowhead). The end of the leader lines is that end which points outward from the pie slice or sector.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PieLabelAppearance.LeaderDrawStyle
member.summary: Gets/set the style with which the leader lines are drawn.

remarks.p: The leader lines can be drawn in a variety of styles such as Solid, Dot, Dash, et al. See the LineDrawStyle enumeration for details.
The value of any leader line styling property is ignored if is False.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PieLabelAppearance.BorderColor
member.summary: Gets/sets the color of the border around the Pie Chart text Labels.

remarks.p: Label borders are not supported by 3-D Pie Charts.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PieLabelAppearance.FillColor
member.summary: Gets/sets the fill color of the Pie Chart labels' text box.

remarks.p: Developers can cause the Pie Chart labels to appear floating in mid-air by setting this property and to Color.Transparent.
Label background fills are not supported by 3-D Pie Charts.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PieLabelAppearance.BorderThickness
member.summary: The thickness in pixels of the border around the Pie Chart text labels.

remarks.p: Label borders are not supported by 3-D Pie Charts.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.PieLabelAppearance.BorderDrawStyle
member.summary: Gets/sets the style of the border drawn around individual Pie Chart labels.

remarks.p: The border can be drawn in a variety of styles such as Solid, Dot, Dash, et al. Please see the LineDrawStyle enumeration for further information.
Label borders are not supported by 3-D Pie Charts.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScatterChartAppearance
member.summary: An Appearance object that encapsulates the style and presentation properties of Scatter Charts.

remarks.p: Scatter Charts plot scatter points at given X and Y coordinates that are based upon data tuples from the and data columns of the chart's data source.

A scatter chart is often a suitable substitute for a line chart where two numeric continuous axes are required. Developers should use the property of this Appearance to connect scatter points with lines. Connecting lines can also be subject to smoothing through spline fitting with the LineAppearance property.

There are a variety of symbols that can be used to plot scatter points, including shapes and Unicode glyphs. These symboles can be grouped by series when developers configure an additional data column in that relates scatter point tuples of the same series. See the and properties for more details on the selection of symbols.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScatterChartAppearance.NullHandling
member.summary: Specifies whether nulls in the data are treated as zero or an average of adjacent values.

remarks.p: This property specifies whether null data encountered in the bound data source should be treated as having a zero value, or an average value of the adjacent data points.
See the enumeration for the values that indicate how nulls are handled.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScatterChartAppearance.ConnectWithLines
member.summary: Flag indicates whether scatter points are connected with lines.

remarks.p: When set to true, lines connecting each scatter point are drawn in the order the scatter points appear in the data source. If the lines do not connect the scatter points in the way expected, confirm that the data points have been properly ordered before charting.
This property can be employed by developers that require ScatterChart to appear as a line-equivalent chart with two continuous axes (since LineChart by definition has a discrete X-Axis).

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScatterChartAppearance.Icon
member.summary: Retrieves an enumeration which determines what SymbolIcon to use when rendering each scatter plot series.

remarks.p: The Icon property identifies an icon that is plotted by-series of scatter points. The icon can be one of several shapes, or letters.

When this property is set to Character, each scatter point will be displayed as specified by the property. If there are more scatter points than the number of potential characters, then characters will be reused.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScatterChartAppearance.IconSize
member.summary: Determines the size of the SymbolIcon to render for each data series.

remarks.p: If IconSize is set to Auto then UltraChart automatically chooses a size based on the number of points that are being plotted.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScatterChartAppearance.Character
member.summary: Specifies the individual Character to render for each scatter point.

remarks.p: This property is only used when is set to Character.
If there is more than one series of data (see GroupByColumn) then the char used for each series of data will be incremented starting with this property value.
When the selected character is a Unicode glyph, it is the developer's responsibility to ensure that the character code is represented in the selected, otherwise the results are undefined.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScatterChartAppearance.CharacterFont
member.summary: Specifies the Font of the Character to use to render each Scatter point.

remarks.p: This property only applies when is set to Character.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScatterChartAppearance.UseGroupByColumn
member.summary: Specifies whether the chart will use the GroupByColumn.

remarks.p: See the property for more information.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScatterChartAppearance.GroupByColumn
member.summary: Specifies a zero-based index of the data column used when grouping data into scatter series.

remarks.p: This property is ignored when the property has been set to False.
The column specified must contain a set of repeating, numeric values that are used to group each set of data points into a series of related scatter points.
A different Character or SymbolIcon (based on the setting of ) is used to render each data series related by this grouping column.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScatterChartAppearance.ColumnX
member.summary: Gets/sets the column index to be used for X-Axis values when rendering a Scatter Chart.

remarks.p: This property can be used to specify which column in the data will be rendered along the horizontal X-Axis of the Scatter Chart. The column index is zero-based (i.e., the first column is at index 0).

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScatterChartAppearance.ColumnY
member.summary: Gets/sets the column index to be used for Y-Axis values when rendering a Scatter Chart.

remarks.p: This property can be used to specify which column in the data will be rendered along the Y-Axis of the Scatter Chart. The column index is zero-based (i.e., the first column is at index 0).

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScatterChartAppearance.LineAppearance
member.summary: Gets the SplineAppearance object, which determines the tension of the lines connecting scatter points.

remarks.p: Developers may apply smoothing to the connecting lines (when is True), by specifying a spline tension value greater than 0.0 on the SplineTension property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScatterChartAppearance.ChartText
member.summary: Collection of Chart Text objects that can be displayed onto this Scatter Chart.
member.value: A reference to the of the current Scatter Chart.

remarks.p: Developers can Add instances of the class to this collection to cause supplemental text labels to be rendered within the charting grid area beside chart elements.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.RadarChartAppearance.LineEndCapStyle
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that determines the style applied at the end of lines.

remarks.p: This property specifies the end cap style of the data line plotted on the Radar Chart (some examples of endcaps include arrowheads, bulbous endpoints, et al.)

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.RadarChartAppearance.MidPointAnchors
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether or not the data points between plotted line segments are displayed in the Radar Chart.

remarks.p: This property specifies whether to show the data points between line segments. Normally line segments join each other smoothly to form a continuous, bent line. By setting this flag developers can specify an enlarged point (an anchor) be plotted at the junctions of adjacent line segments.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.RadarChartAppearance.LineDrawStyle
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that determines the style of a radial axis line.

remarks.p: This property determines the drawing style of the radial axis lines.
The property specifies the thickness of an axis line.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.RadarChartAppearance.LineThickness
member.summary: Returns a reference to or sets a Color object that specifies the thickness of the data lines on a plotted Radar Chart.

remarks.p: This property specifies the thickness of data lines appearing on a Radar Chart.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.RadarChartAppearance.SplineTension
member.summary: Retrieves or adjusts the spline tension.

remarks.p: The spline tension controls how tightly the curve bends to fit the data points. The spline value should be greater than 0.0 but less than 0.5, with higher values leading to more sweeping, smoothened curves.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.RadarChartAppearance.ColorFill
member.summary: Defines in which Color the Radar Chart is filled.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScatterLineAppearance
member.summary: An Appearance object governing the presentation of the Scatter-Line hybrid chart.

remarks.p: As with any hybrid chart appearance, instances of the ScatterLineAppearance class are dual-binding. This class exposes an Appearance and DataAppearance property of both the Scatter Chart (tied to the X- and Y- axes) and the Line Chart (tied to the secondary X2- and Y2- axes).

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScatterLineAppearance.#ctor

remarks.p: Calling the default constructor of any hybrid chart's appearance object is not recommended from application code. If it is necessary to use this constructor from a custom layer implementation, it is incumbent on the developer to initialize the , , and properties.

remarks.p: This property provides access to the Scatter Chart's appearance properties, and should be used by developers when customizing the appearance of the Scatter Chart component of the hybrid chart.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScatterLineAppearance.ScatterData
member.summary: Returns a DataAppearance object that is used to configure the data connection of the Scatter Chart layer to a separate data source.

remarks.p: This property exposes a distinct DataAppearance for the ScatterChart component of the present hybrid chart. Developers must set a DataSource on this property and invoke DataBind on it when specifying data for the ScatterChart component of the hybrid chart.
For more information, see the DataAppearance class.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScatterLineAppearance.LineData
member.summary: Returns a DataAppearance object that is used to configure the data connection of the Line Chart layer to a separate data source.
